    • Method Detail

      • getScope

        public static java.util.Map getScope(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        gets the gate permissions scope. The scope is the place to put external objects needed by gates logical evaluation (like the current user) which are not the permissible istelf (so objects other than the current object on which the permission query is invoked on)
        Parameters:
        session -
        Returns:

      • putInScope

        public static void putInScope(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                              MetaInfo key,
                              java.lang.Object value)
        Puts an objects in the permission scope. This will be later used by a gate to evaluate if an action is allowed or not
        Parameters:
        session - the http session (where the scope lies)
        key - the scope key that can be used to get the object back
        value - the object

        public static java.util.Map getScope(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        gets the gate permissions scope. The scope is the place to put external objects needed by gates logical evaluation (like the current user) which are not the permissible istelf (so objects other than the current object on which the permission query is invoked on)
        Parameters:
        session -
        Returns:

      • getFromScope

        public static java.lang.Object getFromScope(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                            MetaInfo key)
        Gets the object associated with the given key, if any, from the permissions scope
        Parameters:
        session -
        key - the key used to put the object in the scope with putInScope
        Returns:
        the object
        See Also:
        putInScope(HttpSession, MetaInfo, Object)

      • getAvailableGates

        public static java.lang.Class[] getAvailableGates(javax.servlet.ServletContext sc)
        list here all the available gates in the system. Since subclass search through reflection is not supported by Java, we need a list with them All Gates must extend the Gate class

      • getOwnPermissionMapForPermissible

        public static PermissionMap getOwnPermissionMapForPermissible(Permissible obj)
        Gets the permission map assigned to the given permissible. Ignores any global permission, if any
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:
        the permission map assigned

      • getPermissionMapForPermissible

        public static PermissionMap getPermissionMapForPermissible(Permissible obj)
        Gets the permission map assigned to the given permissible. If no permission map is assigned to it specifically, the global permission map assigned to its class is returned (if any).
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:
        the permission map assigned
